channel.title: Bots spammed every forum I've had and web host! :(
channel.description:
I always get spammed by bots, on every forum I've used (VB/MyBB/SMF), I've had like all the security added such as captcha etc etc and I've had multiple web hosts.
I can just never find the solution to my problem! Does anybody know how to get around bots filling up my forum?

item.title: Bots spammed every forum I've had and web host! :(
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:496600”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=614830.msg4242683#msg4242683 date=1361911507]

SMF has a section (I believe) where you can block/ban IP’s from visiting your forums.
Here’s a couple links with lists of bot IP’s:

http://forums.appthemes.com/list-bad-ip-spam-29759/
http://badip.4rev.net/
http://www.spam-whackers.com/bad.bots/01-75.htm
http://www.spam-whackers.com/bad.bots/76-99.htm
http://www.spam-whackers.com/bad.bots/100-199.htm
http://www.spam-whackers.com/bad.bots/200-299.htm

GL.

IP banning wouldn’t be the solution because they’re all registered under a different IP?
[/quote]

Not always, if you’ve ever taken the time to look into the bot’s IPs (some even have similar usernames/emails) they are registered with the same IP address. They can (and do, a lot) come from the same IP address.
I remember having some forums with over 65 bots on it, I banned 3 IP’s and poof they all went.[/quote]

Yes but the bots spamming me are almost on different IP addresses

Read full topic
item.source: Bots spammed every forum I've had and web host! :(

item.title: Bots spammed every forum I've had and web host! :(
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:11, topic:496600”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=614830.msg4241065#msg4241065 date=1361833916]
SMF has a section (I believe) where you can block/ban IP’s from visiting your forums.
Here’s a couple links with lists of bot IP’s:

http://forums.appthemes.com/list-bad-ip-spam-29759/
http://badip.4rev.net/
http://www.spam-whackers.com/bad.bots/01-75.htm
http://www.spam-whackers.com/bad.bots/76-99.htm
http://www.spam-whackers.com/bad.bots/100-199.htm
http://www.spam-whackers.com/bad.bots/200-299.htm

GL.
[/quote]

IP banning wouldn’t be the solution because they’re all registered under a different IP?[/quote]

Not always, if you’ve ever taken the time to look into the bot’s IPs (some even have similar usernames/emails) they are registered with the same IP address. They can (and do, a lot) come from the same IP address.
I remember having some forums with over 65 bots on it, I banned 3 IP’s and poof they all went.

Read full topic

item.title: Bots spammed every forum I've had and web host! :(
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

The problem is that some “bots” are actually humans behind computers being paid to spam advertisements. It’s very tricky to stop those.

Silab offers another popular alternative method though.

Read full topic
item.source: Bots spammed every forum I've had and web host! :(

item.title: Bots spammed every forum I've had and web host! :(
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

justaguy:

bots can target any webhost or forum software that you use. To get most bots away, you can always use registration questions that are suited to your particular forum. Another popular method is using CAPTCHAs such as animated ones or ones like avatar verification (I’ve used this and it was very effective for me) CAPTCHAs.

Tried it before, did not work; I’ve tried all sorts of captcha.

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:496600”]SMF has a section (I believe) where you can block/ban IP’s from visiting your forums.
Here’s a couple links with lists of bot IP’s:

http://forums.appthemes.com/list-bad-ip-spam-29759/
http://badip.4rev.net/
http://www.spam-whackers.com/bad.bots/01-75.htm
http://www.spam-whackers.com/bad.bots/76-99.htm
http://www.spam-whackers.com/bad.bots/100-199.htm
http://www.spam-whackers.com/bad.bots/200-299.htm

GL.[/quote]

IP banning wouldn’t be the solution because they’re all registered under a different IP?

[quote=“Spades, post:8, topic:496600”]http://www.cloudflare.com/

That helps prevent attacks and spam bots.[/quote]

Is the lite version even any good? I wasn’t really looking for spending any money.

IP ban’s not really the answer because the bots are all on different IP addresses?

Miss Silabsoft:

the honeypot method that reines uses for fluxbb is really effective, it took a few weeks to get the majority of the spambots already registered on my forums but after installing the honeypot script its been a breeze. I am sure other forum softwares have similar methods.

I’ll look into it, thanks

edit: just realized the bots have been generating traffic on my website lol…

Read full topic
item.source: Bots spammed every forum I've had and web host! :(

item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

Cloudflare

Cloudflare - The Web Performance & Security Company | Cloudflare

Here at Cloudflare, we make the Internet work the way it should. Offering CDN, DNS, DDoS protection and security, find out how we can help your site.

That helps prevent attacks and spam bots.

item.title: Bots spammed every forum I've had and web host! :(
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Coldmedicine, post:5, topic:496600”][quote author=justaguy link=topic=614830.msg4240976#msg4240976 date=1361827434]

  1. code your own website
  2. dont make forums

You’re joking right.

Anyhow, bots can target any webhost or forum software that you use. To get most bots away, you can always use registration questions that are suited to your particular forum. Another popular method is using CAPTCHAs such as animated ones or ones like avatar verification (I’ve used this and it was very effective for me) CAPTCHAs.
[/quote]
I was, bad mood today, xD.[/quote]

bad mood and stupidity have no relationship, really.

Read full topic
